story:
Xin chào (hello) young boy! Tonight, I'd like to tell you a special story that will transport you to a magical world, far, far away from your bedsheets.

In a small village nestled in the countryside, there was a legendary giant named Lạc Việt. Lạc was as big as a mountain, with skin as rough as the bark of an ancient tree and hair that flowed like the river during a spring downpour. He was the guardian of the land, keeping the rice fields fertile and the rivers flowing with crystal clear water.

Every year, the people of the village would celebrate the harvest festival, and Lạc would join them. He would dance under the full moon, his enormous strides causing the earth to tremble, and his laughter echoing through the valleys. The villagers would offer him sweet rice cakes and fragrant incense, and Lạc would promise to bring prosperity and good fortune to the land.

One day, a young boy named Bảo (which means "precious" in Vietnamese) wandered into the forest, searching for a lost puppy. As he wandered deeper into the trees, he stumbled upon Lạc, who was taking a nap under a giant banyan tree. The giant woke up, startled, and smiled at the little boy.

"Why are you so brave to venture into the forest all alone?" Lạc asked in a rumbling voice that shook the leaves.

Bảo explained about his lost puppy, and Lạc offered to help him find it. Together, they set off through the forest, Lạc moving his enormous strides to keep up with the little boy's eager steps. As they walked, Lạc told stories of his adventures, of the hidden waterfalls and secret caves that only he knew about.

As the sun began to set, they finally found the lost puppy, wagging its tail and yapping with joy. Bảo hugged his pup tightly and thanked Lạc for his help. As a reward, he offered Lạc a special gift – a small, delicate lotus flower.

Lạc's eyes twinkled with delight as he accepted the gift. He smelled the sweet fragrance and declared that the lotus would bring good fortune to the village. From that day on, the villagers watched their crops grow stronger and their rivers run clearer, and they believed that the magic of the lotus had been passed from Lạc to the land itself.

As the years passed, the villagers would tell stories of Lạc's kindness, and the legend of the giant and the little boy with the lost puppy became a part of their heritage. And every night, under the full moon, Lạc would dance once more, his footsteps echoing through the valleys, reminding the people of the magic that lay just beyond their village.

Now, my dear son, it's time for you to go to sleep. Remember the story of Lạc and Bảo, and may the magic of the lotus flower guide you through your dreams. May you always find your way, even in the darkest of forests, and may your heart remain as brave as Bảo's.

Tạm biệt, con ơi (goodnight, my dear). May your slumber be as peaceful as the river's flow and your heart filled with the sweetness of the lotus flower.
